validationRules.styleType: Required - Must be one of 8 styles: 'style-1' through 'style-8'. Each style has unique layout/positioning
validationRules.Title: Required string - Main headline/banner title
validationRules.subTitle: Optional string - Subtitle/tagline (recommended for context)
validationRules.desc: Optional string - Description text, supports HTML for formatting (bold, links, line breaks)
validationRules.bannerImage: Object with url property - Background image (url can be empty for solid color background)
validationRules.imageSize: WordPress image size: 'thumbnail', 'medium', 'large', 'full', or custom size name
validationRules.titleTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable title typography controls
validationRules.subtitleTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable subtitle typography controls
validationRules.titleColor: Hex color code for title normal state (e.g., '#ffffff')
validationRules.titlehoverColor: Hex color code for title hover state - creates smooth color transition
validationRules.subtitleColor: Hex color code for subtitle normal state
validationRules.subtitlehoverColor: Hex color code for subtitle hover state - creates smooth color transition

warnings: ‚ö†Ô∏è hoverStyle effects only work when bannerImage.url is provided (image required for zoom/slide/fade)
‚ö†Ô∏è Empty bannerImage.url displays solid color background - use for typography-focused CTAs

‚ö†Ô∏è desc field supports HTML - use

, , ,
for formatting (avoid complex HTML)
‚ö†Ô∏è Hover colors (titlehoverColor, subtitlehoverColor) require transition to look smooth - CSS handles this automatically
‚ö†Ô∏è Very large text (fontSize > 80px) may break layout on small screens - always set responsive xs values
‚ö†Ô∏è styleType layouts differ significantly - style-1 vs style-8 have very different text positioning
‚ö†Ô∏è imageSize 'full' may load very large images - use 'large' for better performance unless full resolution needed
‚ö†Ô∏è cta_img_zoom effect can make text harder to read if image zooms behind text - test readability
‚ö†Ô∏è Emoji in desc (üî•, üì•) may not render on all devices - use sparingly or provide text alternative
‚ö†Ô∏è openTypography must be 1 BEFORE setting fontSize, fontWeight, etc. - otherwise typography ignored
‚ö†Ô∏è Missing subTitle may cause layout issues in some styles - provide at least short text
‚ö†Ô∏è cta_img_vertical/horizontal slide distance depends on image size - may need image adjustments
‚ö†Ô∏è Hover effects don't work on touch devices without tap - design should work without hover states
‚ö†Ô∏è bannerImage aspect ratio affects layout - use consistent ratios (16:9, 4:3, etc.) across banners
commonMistakes: ‚ùå Setting hoverStyle effects without bannerImage (effects won't display)
‚ùå Forgetting openTypography:1 before setting fontSize/fontWeight (text styles ignored)
‚ùå Using same color for titleColor and titlehoverColor (no hover feedback)
‚ùå Not setting responsive fontSize values for xs breakpoint (huge text on mobile)
‚ùå Using complex HTML in desc field (may break layout - keep simple)
‚ùå Not optimizing bannerImage (large uncompressed images slow page load)
‚ùå Setting imageSize:'full' for all banners (wastes bandwidth - use 'large' often sufficient)
‚ùå Leaving subTitle empty in styles that depend on it for layout balance
‚ùå Using low-contrast text colors against bannerImage (poor readability)
‚ùå Forgetting to test hover effects on actual devices (may look different than editor)
‚ùå Using cta_img_zoom on banners with important background details (zoom hides content)
‚ùå Not providing desc when space is available (missed opportunity for details)
‚ùå Using too many different hover effects on same page (inconsistent UX)
‚ùå Setting fontWeight values as numbers instead of strings (should be '700' not 700)
‚ùå Not accounting for text length - very long titles may overflow on small screens
bestPractices: ‚úÖ Use bannerImage from WordPress media library and set appropriate imageSize for performance
‚úÖ Always set titlehoverColor different from titleColor for clear hover feedback
‚úÖ Provide responsive fontSize values: large on md (48-72px), medium on sm (36-54px), small on xs (24-38px)
‚úÖ Use desc field for additional context, CTAs, or social proof (testimonials, stats)
‚úÖ Keep Title concise - 2-6 words max for impact (e.g., 'Start Free Trial', not full sentence)
‚úÖ Use subTitle to add context or urgency ('Limited Time', 'No Credit Card', 'Join 10,000+ Users')
‚úÖ Choose hover effect matching content: zoom for products, fade for minimal, slide for dynamic
‚úÖ Optimize bannerImage to < 200KB - compress before upload, use appropriate dimensions
‚úÖ Use cta_img_zoom for product focus, cta_img_fade for subtle transitions, cta_img_vertical/horizontal for energy
‚úÖ Combine CTA banner with tp-button block below for complete conversion funnel
‚úÖ Use high-contrast colors for text against bannerImage background (white on dark, dark on light)
‚úÖ Test readability on actual background image - add overlay if text hard to read
‚úÖ Use textTransform:'uppercase' with letterSpacing for modern, bold headlines

‚úÖ Keep desc HTML simple:

for paragraphs, for emphasis,
for breaks only
‚úÖ Use consistent styleType across similar banners on same page for visual coherence
‚úÖ Set lineHeight 1.1-1.3em for titles (tight), 1.4-1.6em for descriptions (readable)
‚úÖ Use style-1, style-2, style-3 for general CTAs; style-8 for minimal/hero sections
‚úÖ Provide fallback solid background color via container for banners without images
‚úÖ Use emoji sparingly in desc (üî•, ‚ö°, üì•) for attention, but provide text context
‚úÖ A/B test different hover effects and colors to optimize conversions

accessibilityNotes: ‚ôø Ensure sufficient color contrast between text (titleColor) and bannerImage background (WCAG AA: 4.5:1)
‚ôø Provide meaningful Title text - avoid vague CTAs like 'Click Here' (use 'Download Free Guide')
‚ôø Don't rely on hover effects to convey essential information - touch devices can't hover
‚ôø Use desc field to provide additional context for screen readers
‚ôø Ensure bannerImage has alt text set via WordPress media library
‚ôø Test color combinations in hover states for accessibility (titlehoverColor contrast)
‚ôø Avoid flashing or rapidly changing hover effects (can trigger seizures)

‚ôø Use semantic HTML in desc field (

, ) for proper screen reader parsing
‚ôø Ensure CTA remains usable without images (when bannerImage fails to load)
‚ôø Provide clear call-to-action language in Title/subTitle for cognitive accessibility
performanceConsiderations: ‚ö° Optimize bannerImage to < 200KB - use compression tools before upload
‚ö° Use appropriate imageSize - 'large' (1024px) often sufficient instead of 'full' (2000px+)
‚ö° Use WebP format with JPEG fallback for 30-50% smaller file sizes
‚ö° Lazy load banners below fold - WordPress handles this automatically for img tags
‚ö° Limit number of CTA banners per page - too many slow initial render
‚ö° CSS hover effects (zoom/fade/slide) are GPU-accelerated - very performant
‚ö° Avoid excessive HTML in desc field - keep simple for faster DOM parsing
‚ö° Use consistent imageSize across all banners for browser caching benefits
‚ö° Consider using solid color backgrounds (empty bannerImage) for faster load times
‚ö° Test on slow 3G networks - CTA banners should load quickly as they're conversion-critical
